hero.title: Safeturned
hero.subtitle: Keep your Unturned server safe. We check plugins for backdoors and sketchy stuff so you don't have to.

results.title: Analysis Results
results.notFoundDescription: Couldn't find that analysis. Double-check the hash or upload a new file.
results.reanalyzeDescription: Want to scan this file again? Hit the button below for fresh results.
results.reanalyzeInfo: We don't store files. Reanalyzing updates the scan results using stored metadata (file hash and name).
results.reanalysisSuccess: File reanalyzed successfully with latest security checks!
results.fileNotStoredError: This file is not available for reanalysis. Please upload it again to scan with the latest security checks.
results.reanalyzeAvailableWebsite: Website uploads: Stored up to 24h OR 10GB total (can reanalyze)
results.reanalyzeNotAvailableApi: API uploads: Analyzed and immediately deleted (cannot reanalyze)
results.reanalyzeNotStoredExplanation: This file was uploaded via API (analyzed and deleted immediately) or expired from temporary server memory (24h/10GB limit exceeded). Files are never stored permanently.
results.reanalyzeUploadAgain: If reanalysis fails, simply upload the file again to get fresh results with the latest security checks.

securityAnalysis.title: Security Analysis
securityAnalysis.blacklistedCommandsDesc: Scans for dangerous Rocket console commands (admin, shutdown, ban, etc.)
securityAnalysis.detectionsNote: These detections indicate potential security risks or suspicious behaviors found during static analysis. Not all detections are malicious - legitimate software may also trigger some of these checks depending on its functionality.

features.title: What We Do
features.codeAnalysisDescription: We dig through plugin code to find anything that looks sketchy or off
features.threatDetectionDescription: Catches backdoors, trojans, and other nasty stuff hiding in your plugins
features.fastCheckDescription: Get your results in seconds, not hours. We'll show you exactly what we found

step1.title: Upload your plugin
step1.description: Just drag and drop your .dll file. That's it.

step2.title: We scan it
step2.description: Our system looks for sketchy code, backdoors, and anything that seems off

step3.title: See the results
step3.description: Get a clear report showing what we found and whether your plugin is safe to use

footer.protectionMessage: Keep your server safe, one plugin at a time
footer.disclaimer: This site is not affiliated with Smartly Dressed Games or Unturned. Unturned¬Æ is a registered trademark or trademark of Smartly Dressed Games Ltd. in the United States, Canada, and other countries.

errors.fileTooLarge: File is too large. Maximum size is 500 MB.
errors.analysisTimeout: Analysis is taking longer than expected (waited 2 minutes). Please try again in a few moments or check back later.

dragDrop.tip: üí° Tip: You can drag and drop .dll files anywhere on this page to scan them
dragDrop.overlayDescription: Release to upload and analyze your .dll file
dragDrop.title: Drop file here
dragDrop.subtitle: Drag your .dll file to analyze

uploadModal.title: Upload file for analysis
uploadModal.subtitle: Select a .dll file to analyze for security threats
uploadModal.dragDropHint: Or drag and drop a file here
uploadModal.disclaimer: By uploading, you agree to our Terms of Service and Privacy Notice. Don't upload personal info - we're not responsible for what you submit.

scanning.longRunning: This is taking longer than usual
scanning.longRunningDescription: Your file's been processing for {{elapsedTime}} seconds. This is normal for bigger files.

consent.prefix: By uploading, you agree to our

dashboard.uploadFirstFile: Upload your first file to get started
dashboard.upgradePremium: Upgrade to Premium for higher rate limits, larger file uploads, and priority support!

scans.title: Scan History
scans.description: View your past file scans and results
scans.noScansDesc: Upload a file to see your scan results here
scans.resultUnavailable: Scan result is not available. File hash not found.

createModal.title: Create New API Key
createModal.keyNameHelp: Give your key a descriptive name to identify where it will be used
createModal.placeholder: e.g., My Server, Development, Personal Project
createModal.scopesHelp: Select which operations this API key can perform
createModal.scopeReadDesc: View file scan results and analytics
createModal.scopeAnalyzeDesc: Upload and scan files for threats

keyCreated.title: API Key Created!
keyCreated.message: Save this key securely - you won't be able to see it again!

deleteConfirm.title: Revoke API Key?
deleteConfirm.message: Are you sure you want to revoke
deleteConfirm.warning: This can't be undone - any apps using this key will stop working immediately.

regenerateConfirm.title: Regenerate API Key?
regenerateConfirm.warning: Your old key will stop working right away, and you'll get a new one.

page.title: API Keys
page.subtitle: Manage your API keys for programmatic access
page.limitReachedTooltip: API key limit reached for your tier

limitWarning.title: API Key Limit Reached
limitWarning.message: You've reached the maximum of {{max}} active API key{{plural}} for your current tier. Revoke an existing key to create a new one, or upgrade your plan for more keys.

emptyState.title: No API Keys Yet
emptyState.subtitle: Create your first API key to get started

errors.reservedName: This key name is reserved and managed by Safeturned.
errors.protectedKey: This managed key cannot be regenerated or revoked.

usage.title: API Usage & Analytics
usage.description: Monitor your API key usage and performance metrics
usage.description4: Uploading files through the website doesn't count as API usage.
usage.note: Note: Website uploads show up in your
usage.noRequestsInDays: No API requests in the last {{days}} days
usage.startUsingKeys: Start using your API keys to see activity here
usage.apiRequestStats: API request statistics when you use your API keys

notifications.title: Notifications
notifications.description: Stay updated with your scan results and alerts
notifications.noNotificationsDesc: You don't have any notifications yet. Upload files to start scanning!
notifications.aboutDesc1: This page shows notifications for all your scan results. Threat notifications mean files might be dangerous and need your attention.
notifications.aboutDesc2: Clean notifications mean files passed our security checks.

acceptance.title: 1. Acceptance of Terms
acceptance.content: By accessing and using Safeturned, you accept and agree to be bound by the terms and provision of this agreement. If you do not agree to abide by the above, please do not use this service.

description.title: 2. Description of Service
description.content: Safeturned is a security analysis service that scans plugin files (.dll) for potential backdoors, trojans, and other malicious components. The service provides automated code analysis and threat detection for Unturned server plugins.

fileOwnership.title: File Ownership
fileOwnership.content: You must only upload files that you own or have permission to analyze

noPersonalInfo.title: No Personal Information
noPersonalInfo.content: Do not submit any personal information or sensitive data

legalUse.title: Legal Use
legalUse.content: Use the service only for legitimate security analysis purposes

noMaliciousIntent.title: No Malicious Intent
noMaliciousIntent.content: Do not use the service to analyze files with the intent to harm others

compliance.title: Compliance
compliance.content: Comply with all applicable laws and regulations

noGuarantees.title: No Guarantees
noGuarantees.content: We do not guarantee 100% effectiveness of threat detection

falsePositives.title: False Positives
falsePositives.content: Legitimate files may be flagged as suspicious

falseNegatives.title: False Negatives
falseNegatives.content: Some threats may not be detected

rateLimits.title: Rate Limits
rateLimits.content: Requests are rate-limited by operation type. Free tier: 2,000 reads, 150 writes, 30 file uploads per hour. Verified: 5,000/500/75. Premium: 15,000/2,000/200. Bot: 50,000/20,000/1,000 with 100/min burst limit. Excessive usage may result in temporary suspension.

websiteUploads.title: Website Uploads (Temporary Storage)
websiteUploads.content: Files uploaded through the website are temporarily stored in server memory for up to 24 hours OR until total memory usage exceeds 10GB (whichever comes first). This enables the reanalysis feature. Oldest files are automatically deleted to protect server resources.

apiUploads.title: API Uploads (No Storage)
apiUploads.content: Files uploaded via API are analyzed immediately and deleted right after analysis completes. They cannot be reanalyzed without re-uploading.

chunkedUploads.title: Large File Chunks
chunkedUploads.content: For large files (>100MB), files are temporarily stored in encrypted chunks during upload and processing. All chunks are automatically deleted after analysis completes or if the session expires (24 hours maximum).

metadataOnly.title: Metadata Only
metadataOnly.content: Only file metadata (hash, name, size, scan results, assembly information) is stored permanently. The actual file contents are never permanently stored.

analyticsData.title: Analytics Data
analyticsData.content: Aggregated anonymous statistics are collected for service improvement and public display.

yourFiles.title: Your Files
yourFiles.content: You retain all rights to your uploaded files

ourService.title: Our Service
ourService.content: Safeturned and its analysis algorithms are our intellectual property

openSource.title: Open Source
openSource.content: The service is open source and available under appropriate licenses

noClaims.title: No Claims
noClaims.content: We make no claims on your intellectual property

noWarranty.title: No Warranty
noWarranty.content: The service is provided "as is" without any warranties

noLiability.title: No Liability
noLiability.content: We are not liable for any damages arising from use of the service

securityDecisions.title: Security Decisions
securityDecisions.content: You are responsible for your own security decisions

thirdPartyContent.title: Third-Party Content
thirdPartyContent.content: We are not responsible for the content of analyzed files

serviceAvailability.title: Service Availability
serviceAvailability.content: We do not guarantee uninterrupted service availability

illegalActivities.title: Illegal Activities
illegalActivities.content: Using the service for illegal purposes

harassment.title: Harassment
harassment.content: Using the service to harass or harm others

reverseEngineering.title: Reverse Engineering
reverseEngineering.content: Attempting to reverse engineer our systems

bypassingSecurity.title: Bypassing Security
bypassingSecurity.content: Attempting to bypass rate limits or security measures

multipleAccounts.title: Multiple Accounts
multipleAccounts.content: You are not allowed to register multiple accounts to circumvent rate limits or other service limitations

termination.title: 9. Termination
termination.content: We reserve the right to terminate or suspend access to our service immediately, without prior notice or liability, for any reason whatsoever, including without limitation if you breach the Terms.

changes.title: 10. Changes to Terms
changes.content: We reserve the right, at our sole discretion, to modify or replace these Terms at any time. If a revision is material, we will try to provide at least 30 days notice prior to any new terms taking effect.

governingLaw.title: 11. Governing Law
governingLaw.content: These Terms shall be interpreted and governed by the laws of the jurisdiction in which the service operates, without regard to its conflict of law provisions.

contact.title: 12. Contact Information
contact.content: If you have any questions about these Terms of Service, please contact us through our GitHub repository or other official channels.

badges.title: Manage Badges
badges.description: Create badges for your scanned files to show in your README
badges.aboutDescription: Badges are links you can add to your README that show your scan results. They update automatically when you link new files.
badges.securityDescription: Your badges are yours alone. Nobody else can change what they show, even if they upload a file with the same name.
badges.createFromResult: Want to create a badge? Head to any scan result page and hit "Create Badge"
badges.noBadgesDesc: Pick one of your scanned files below to create a badge.
badges.noScannedFilesDesc: You haven't scanned anything yet. Upload a file to get started!
badges.hashUnavailable: Hash missing - go to the result page to create a badge
badges.noHash: This file doesn't have a hash, so we can't create a badge for it.
badges.recommendedDescription: Get your own badge ID that only you control. This stops anyone else from messing with your badge, even if they upload a file with the same name.
badges.createSecureDescription: Want a badge that only you can update? Just
badges.secureDescription: and you're good to go. Secure badges can't be hijacked by others.
badges.warningDescription: The filename-based badges below can be taken over if someone uploads a file with the same name.
badges.useSecure: For real projects, use the secure badges above instead.
badges.createSecureForProduction: to make secure badges for your projects.
badges.quickBadge: Quick badges by filename (not as secure):
badges.autoUpdate: The badge updates automatically when you re-scan the file. It links back to this page.
badges.autoUpdateDescription: When enabled, this badge will automatically update when you upload new versions of your file with the update token. You'll receive a secure token to include in your uploads.
badges.tokenWarning: Save this token securely - it won't be shown again!
badges.tokenDescription: Include this token when uploading files to automatically update this badge. Keep it secret!
badges.tokenSecurityWarning: ‚ö†Ô∏è Never share this token publicly or commit it to version control. Anyone with this token can update your badge.

deleteConfirm.title: Delete Badge?
deleteConfirm.message: Are you sure you want to delete the badge "{{badgeName}}"? This action cannot be undone.

regenerateTokenConfirm.title: Regenerate Token?
regenerateTokenConfirm.message: Are you sure you want to regenerate the token for badge "{{badgeName}}"? Your old token will stop working immediately and you'll receive a new one.

badges.duplicateWarning: You already have a badge for this file:
badges.duplicateConfirm: Do you want to create another badge?
badges.autoUpdateTokenDescription: Enable auto-update to receive a secure token. Include this token when uploading new versions to automatically update your badge without changing the badge URL.
badges.perfectForCICD: üí° Perfect for CI/CD pipelines and automated releases
badges.tokenFieldDescription: Include the badgeToken field when uploading to auto-update all your badges with that token.
badges.badgeBrandingDescription: All badges include the Safeturned shield logo for instant recognition. Each badge has a verification page showing the linked file hash, scan results, and badge details for complete transparency.

risk.highRiskDescription: High risk detected. Do not use this file.
risk.moderateRiskDescription: Suspicious patterns found. Use with caution.
risk.lowRiskDescription: Some concerns detected. Review before use.
risk.safeDescription: No threats found. File appears safe.
risk.apiCalls: API calls and system access patterns
risk.onlyIfTrust: Only use if you trust the source

login.title: Login to manage your API keys and scans
login.agreeTerms: By logging in, you agree to our
login.viewHistory: See your scan history and usage stats
login.higherLimits: Rate limits: 2K reads, 150 writes, 30 uploads per hour (upgrade to Premium for 15K reads, 2K writes, 200 uploads)

loader.title: Server Integration
loader.pageSubtitle: Automatically scan and protect your Unturned server plugins
loader.apiKeyRequiredDesc: Before using the loader, you need to create an API key with the appropriate scopes. The loader will use this key to authenticate with Safeturned services.
loader.frameworkHelp: Server plugin framework (Module for OpenMod/Unturned modules)
loader.versionHelp: Select loader version. Latest is recommended, older versions available if needed
loader.verifiedDescription: All official Safeturned components (ModuleLoader, PluginInstaller, and ModulePlugin) have been analyzed by our security system and verified as safe.
loader.downloadError: Failed to download. Please try again.
loader.step1Title: Extract the zip to your server's Modules folder
loader.step1Desc: Keep the Safeturned.Loader folder structure intact
loader.step3Title: Add your API key to the configuration
loader.step3Desc: Replace "YOUR_API_KEY" with your actual Safeturned API key
loader.step4Desc: The loader will automatically start scanning your plugins

userManagement.title: User Management
userManagement.viewAndManage: View and manage all users, update tiers, and grant admin privileges
userManagement.revokeAdminMessage: Are you sure you want to revoke admin privileges from {{username}}? They will lose access to all administrative features.
userManagement.grantAdminMessage: Are you sure you want to grant admin privileges to {{username}}? They will have full access to user management and system settings.
userManagement.deactivateUserMessage: Are you sure you want to deactivate {{username}}? They will no longer be able to log in or use the service.
userManagement.activateUserMessage: Are you sure you want to activate {{username}}? They will regain access to the service.

botKey.saveSecurely: Save this key securely. It will not be shown again!
botKey.createFor: Create a Bot tier API key for
botKey.createFailed: Failed to create Bot API key
botKey.botTierNote: üí° Bot tier has very high rate limits (50,000 reads, 20,000 writes, 1,000 uploads per hour). API key will expire in 365 days.

analytics.title: System Analytics
analytics.description: View detailed system analytics, recent activity, and usage trends

docs.title: API Documentation
docs.subtitle: Learn how to use the Safeturned API to scan Unturned plugins programmatically.

gettingStarted.title: Getting Started
gettingStarted.step1: Sign in with Discord or Steam
gettingStarted.step3: Click "Create New Key" and give it a name
gettingStarted.step4: Copy your key and save it somewhere safe (you won't see it again!)

upload.title: Upload and scan a .dll file. Returns the scan results immediately.
upload.paramForce: Set to true to re-scan an existing file (optional)

chunkedUpload.title: Upload large files using chunked upload (for files over 100MB)
chunkedUpload.step1: Initialize upload session with file metadata (fileName, fileSizeBytes, fileHash, totalChunks)
chunkedUpload.step2: Upload each chunk with sessionId, chunkIndex, and chunk data
chunkedUpload.step3: Finalize upload to complete file processing
chunkedUpload.tip: Chunked uploads are ideal for large files, slow connections, or resumable uploads. Each chunk should be 1-5MB for optimal performance.

getByHash.title: Get scan results for a specific file using its SHA-256 hash.

getByFilename.title: Get the most recent scan results for a file by its filename.

codeExamples.title: Code Examples
codeExamples.withKey: with the API key you created in your dashboard.

response.title: Response Format
response.isNew: Whether this is a new scan or cached result
response.lastScanned: When the file was last analyzed
response.fileSizeBytes: Size of the file in bytes

riskScores.title: Understanding Risk Scores
riskScores.safe: File looks safe. No major concerns found.
riskScores.suspicious: Some suspicious patterns detected. Review before using.
riskScores.moderate: Moderate risk. Use with caution and only if you trust the source.
riskScores.dangerous: High risk detected. Don't use this file.

playground.title: üöÄ Try It Out - Interactive API Playground
playground.intro: Test the API right here with your own API key. Great for trying things out before you start coding.
playground.noApiKey: Don't have an API key yet?
playground.securityWarningDesc: Don't share your API key or commit it to version control. It's like your password - anyone with it can access your account. We only store it in your browser while you're on this page.
playground.analyticsDesc: View global API usage statistics across all users. This shows system-wide analytics like total requests, average response times, and overall API performance - not your personal scan history.
playground.chunkedUploadDesc: Files bigger than 100MB need to be uploaded in chunks.
playground.chunkedStep1: Tell us about the file you're uploading
playground.chunkedStep2: Send the file in pieces, one at a time
playground.chunkedStep3: Let us know you're done so we can scan it
playground.chunkedTip: Check out the "Chunked Upload Example" section above for ready-to-use code in multiple languages.
playground.selectFileMsg: Select a file to see the curl command

validationErrors.provideKeyAndFile: Please provide an API key and select a file
validationErrors.provideKeyAndHash: Please provide an API key and hash
validationErrors.provideKeyAndFilename: Please provide an API key and filename

tierFeatures.title: Rate Limits & Tier Features
tierFeatures.tipDesc: Manage your API keys in the
tierFeatures.tipDesc2: . Each tier has a limit on the number of active API keys you can have simultaneously.

badgeTokens.title: Badge Auto-Update Tokens
badgeTokens.description: Badge auto-update tokens allow you to automatically update your verification badges when you upload new versions of your files. This is perfect for CI/CD pipelines and automated releases.
badgeTokens.step2: Save the secure token provided (shown only once)
badgeTokens.step3: Include the token when uploading new file versions
badgeTokens.step4: Your badge updates automatically without changing its URL
badgeTokens.createBadgesDescription: Head to your Badges Dashboard to create badges from your scanned files and enable auto-update functionality.
badgeTokens.usingTokenDescription: When uploading a file, include the badgeToken form field with your token:
badgeTokens.howMatchingDescription: When you upload a file with a badge token, the system automatically finds all badges you own that have auto-update enabled and verifies the token. If the token matches, the badge is updated to point to the newly scanned file.
badgeTokens.securityTip1: Never commit tokens to version control
badgeTokens.securityTip2: Store tokens in environment variables or secure vaults
badgeTokens.securityTip4: One token can update multiple badges (if you have several for the same file)
badgeTokens.cicdDescription: Add the badge token to your GitHub Actions, GitLab CI, or other automation tools to automatically update your badges when you release new versions. Your README badges will always show the latest security status!

badgeInfo.verificationDescription: This page provides transparency about what this security badge represents. You can verify the linked file, scan results, and badge authenticity.

verificationSteps.intro: To verify that this badge matches the plugin file you have, follow these steps:
verificationSteps.step2: Compute the SHA-256 hash of your file:
verificationSteps.step3: Compare the computed hash with the hash shown above
verificationSteps.step4: If the hashes match ‚Üí the badge is verified for your file!
verificationSteps.step5: If they don't match ‚Üí the badge may be for a different version or compromised
verificationSteps.tip: Tip: The hash stays the same for identical files. If the plugin developer releases a new version with auto-update enabled, this badge will automatically show the new version's hash.

badgeInfo.verifiedDescription: This badge is an official Safeturned security verification. The file has been scanned for malicious code, backdoors, and security vulnerabilities.
